content.description: Another dyno, but this time with a little more work on the set up for the jump. In this problem the left hand starts in the pocket for the right hand on Illuminati Dynosaurs, and the right works up the arête before the dyno.
content.location: Main face of the Dynamite Boulder

content.description: Simple problem, start with hands in the 2 best defined pockets and jump for the top
content.protection: Small rock in landing, a pad always helps
content.location: Dynamite Boulder, above the pyramid graffiti

content.description: A sit start, with good low hands and your left knee folded up towards your chest. Left hand moves to around the corner, right moves to a big pinch, right foot to a ledge. stand up and its an easy top out after that.
content.protection: A pad helps with the sit start
content.location: Back arête of the Dynamite Boulder.

content.description: Top Ledge is off limits for traverse. Pumpy, cryptic, and blind. Stand start on ledge of Dynamite Boulder.
content.protection: Mostly flat ground. use crash pad if want to.

content.description: Start with your left hand on the circled ledge, right hand out to the right at about eye level.  Put your left foot below in the undercut area and move your right foot out into a heel hook.  From there, bump you’re right hand up then move your feet up and throw your right hand up for the jug and top out.
content.location: As you walk in from the path, it’s on the first face of the wall opposite the triangle on the other side and just to the left of the down climb area.

content.description: A lowball with several good dynamic routes along the main face. Theres a nice arête, as well as a few possible routes on the “back”, with the last face (closest to the wall) providing a nice way to climb down. A traverse of the main face is also possible. The rock contains several nice crystal pockets, and slopers and ledges around the top.
